column1: One of 2 major approaches to data processing that performs the transformation step within the final storage destination.
One of 2 major approaches to data processing that performs the transformation in memory or in a staging environment before the final load into the destination data store.
Analytics technique that presents historical and current data to help understand the state of a business or system.
Analytics technique that focuses on surfacing the reasons behind a particular event or scenario.
Analytics technique that project future events based on past trends or similar scenarios
Analytics technique that offers recommendations by asserting required actions to achieve a target metric or goal
Analytics technique whose hallmark is the ability to make additional inferences based on analyzing one or more metrics
A simple, relative-measure chart that is useful only for a small number of categories
A data technique that translates information into a visual context to make it easier to understand and gain insights
Describes the use of computing and data resources to aid the identification, discovery, and analysis of critical business data
Larger, richer datasets optimized for decision support and complex questions posed of the data
Operational data that is processed in short, precise, isolated actions. Optimised for speed and accuracy within the interaction
A form of Blob storage optimized for analytics support with a hierarchical folder structure and able to store both Relational data and Non-Relational data
Analytics service built on Apache Spark that supports data processing, machine learning, and analytics via code in notebooks using SQL, R, Python, and Scala
Open-source big data processing service, similar in purpose to Azure Synapse Analytics
Primary orchestration structure for data factory, which organises over datasets into a logical workflow
In the context of Azure Data Factory or Synapse Pipelines, these describe work performed at each step in a Pipeline
Data processing service in Azure that provides a UI to orchestrate data processing activities; Synapse Pipelines are built on the same platform as this resource.
Specialized PowerBI report used to generate and share longer tabular data that can be formatted to fit well on a standard printed page
A collection of Visualizations in Power BI Report Builder that are organized around a theme and allow for drill-down for further detail.
An Azure storage resource that employs the key-value type of Semi-structured data
An Azure data resource well suited for storing and serving up Unstructured Data in the form of images, videos, and PDFs
A scripting language that has many uses - among them, interacting with Azure data resources
A command line language that can be used in a Bash shell to interact with Azure data resources
A security device, in the form of software or hardware, that filters traffic to resources, such as databases.
Which service explicitly defines IP addresses that are authorized to access the database?
A security-related process where a human user or a system is confirmed to be who they say they are
The process of encoding data such that it can be interpreted by a system or human consumer only if they have a key that is passed between the source and the requester.
A data structure that copies and re-orders data or contains pointers to data to improve the speed of data retrieval operations, often at the cost of speed for write operations.
An index is the structure used to sort value to help optimize query performance.
BLANK is a virtual table whose contents is defined through a query.

Azure's cornerstone Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) relational data resource, available in multiple configurations from a single database to databases that approach full Microsoft SQL Server capabilities
A cloud-based Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) offering that is as compatible as possible with the full Microsoft SQL Server platform while still providing the benefits of a fully managed service
An Azure Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) offering that is based on the community edition of a Relational Database that offers many of the advanced features only otherwise found in Azure SQL Database
Relational Database service in the Microsoft cloud that supports multiple tiers of the community edition, which was originally forked off of MySQL
BLANK provides the best way to Provision a set of Azure services to multiple environments and save the configuration for future deployments.
'Infrastructure as code', written in JSON to define and configure Azure resources
Cross-platform database tool for data professionals using onpremises and cloud data platforms on Windows, macOS, and Linux
Data that has no defined structure, often referred to as blobs, but may include metadata associated with files, such as PDFs, images and videos
One of 2 primary table types in star and snowflake data models, this table type often represents events or activities of the data, such as invoices or medical claims.
Acronym that describes the form of Azure service provided by SQL Server on a virtual machine.
Most, but not all, Azure data services fall under the ______ service category, where Azure handles most of the administrative tasks of patching, backups, OS updates and so on
Azure Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) offering that is based on the community edition of a popular open-source database, with some of the advanced features of the Oracle enterprise edition
An acronym describing a type of data workload that is most appropriate for operational data interactions
What does OLTP stand for?
What 4 letter acronym describes the set of rules that OLTP use?
Data that is highly organised with strong rules around the type, form, and format of the stored data. This type of data is very tightly associated with relational databases
Acronym that describes a set of database properties that intend to guarantee data validity despite errors, power failures, concurrent use, and other risks to data integrity
BLANK is information that has some structure, but which allows for some variation between entity instances.
Data that is flexibly organised around entities that can have varying types and amounts of associated descriptive data and hierarchical data per defined entity
What type of database is stored in rows and columns
What type of key is used to uniquely identify records within a table in a database?
A data construct made up of one or more bits of data that uniquely identify an entity in a data store; examples include a key in a row in a table or a key on a JSON document
What type of key is used to link to unique identifiers in other tables in a database?

Data for BLANK is collected over time, often from different data sources, and it is processed as a dataset that includes a range of rows or all rows in the dataset. It is designed to handle processing of large dataset. There is typically a long latency between data collection and data processing.

BLANK is designed for real-time or near real-time processing often as a data load process with minimal processing. Data is either processed as it is generated or in micro-batches of a very few rows with latency of no more than a few milliseconds (very short latency).
Which processing is best suited for following application: reporting the number of users and bandwidth user for an online game.
Which processing is best suited for following application: identifying detected manufacturing errors to automatically reject failing parts.
Which processing is best suited for the following application: data from sensors and IoT devices.
Which processing is best suited for following application: real-time data from users navigating in a website.
A process of organizing data into tables and establishing relationships between those tables in a way designed both to protect the data and to make the database more flexible.
BLANK is the process that is used to split an entity into multiple tables in a Relational databases. This helps to minimize data duplication through the use of related tables.
BLANK is a data structure associated with a table that defines the order in which rows are stored on a disk.
Mechanism for grouping related rows, based on a common property or Partition Key. Rows that share the same Partition Key will be stored together.

BLANK is a standalone Azure service for efficiently analyzing data. You can use the service as the output for analyzing large volumes of diverse data from data sources such as websites, applications, IoT devices, and more.
BLANK is a Relational database in which the data is stored in a schema that is optimized for data analytics rather than Transactional Workloads.
This resource captures real-time and external data — often both Relational and Non-Relational — into an organized data store that can be queried directly.

The most commonly applied data model form employed in Relational databases optimized for Transactional Workloads he most commonly applied data model form employed in Relational databases optimized for Transactional Workloads
Often used interchangeably with the term non-Relational
A data concept that describes how well or how quickly data is kept in sync with itself and with replicas of itself.
A security-related concept that describes what entities can interact with which systems and what they can do during those interactions
An acronym describing a type of data workload that is most appropriate for decision support and business intelligence
Open-source analytics engine used for big data processing
Describes a means for other systems or humans to interact with a resource, such as a cloud database, using an interface that hides the complexity of the source system
A more granular form of access control that provides access rights based on user, environment, or resource attributes
A tool designed to move large volumes of data in and out of Azure Storage
A key in certain types of data resource that buckets multiple items, which could be rows or documents, under a particular category or common filter value
Based on SQL Server Analytics, an analytics service that operates over tabular and dimensional data models
Feature in Synapse Analytics that allows direct loading of data in other forms and formats, such as blobs in parquet format, using T-SQL
A service evolved our of similar tooling for SQL server roperting services and now used to build paginated reports in Power BI
Exploring and analyzing data and building business-friendly data models falls under the responsibility of this data professional.
Many data sources can be queried by some variant of this declarative language
Azure data resource that mimics on-premises file shares and allows applications and humans to interact with it the same way they do on servers and desktop computers
Use this service to bring certain PaaS services hosted on Azure into your private virtual network
The act of setting up the underlying infrastructure of a cloud data resource
Writing code or interacting with a UI to read data from one of more data sources and return the requested data in a particular form or format
An acronym describing a form of access control that depends on putting users in groups, or roles, and providing permissions to those groups, rather than individually to users
The existence of the same piece of data in more than once place, which is acceptable - even optimal in some systems - but not in others
A form of replication of cloud assets that improves accessibility and disaster recovery
Type of database where structured data is organised into tables with rows and columns, where each row is an entity, with predefined columns that are the same for every row
Key-value data resources can combine his with the partition key to form a primary key, which enables fast retrieval of individual entities in a table
Solution for managing and scaling multiple Azure SQL databases that have varying and unpredictable usage demands by flexibly sharing set resources on a single server
Chart that presents the relationship between 2 metrics using dots on X and Y axis
A hallmark of semi-structured data, where the desired form of the returned data is determined by the query
A hallmark of structured, relational data, where the desired form of the data is determined ahead of time and enforced when the data is written to the data tables
A tool designed to manage data stored in a wide variety of formats in Azure using a familiar interface
A popular shell language that can run Azure CLI commands
Data is gathered from one or more sources at regular intervals, usually measured in hours or days, and processed all at the same time
A term that has come to refer to massive amounts of data that is produced in large volumes, at high speed, with a lot of variety in terms of form or content
Similar to a scatter chart but with a third dimension represented by the size of the dots
A Wide-Column database that is supported on Azure through a Cosmos DB API
A windows system protocol for file sharing that allows applications to read and write to files over network-connected computers
An interactive, browser-accessible shell for managing Azure resources. A web-based command line terminal resource, accessible from the Azure portal. This is 100% browser based.
Semi-normalised analytics data model that centers on fact tables, with dimensions related to facts but also related to other dimensions
A type of database that stores tables with rows, where a different set of columns can be defined for each row; also referred to as a Wide-Column database.
An IaaS relational database service offered in Azure
column2: SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines

column1: Describes the operation and impact on data when more than one human or system is operating over the same data at the same time
The primary interface for interacting with Cosmos DB
Tool used to manage and query databases using both UI features and T-SQL code
Denormalized analytics data model that centers on fact tables, with dimension tables directly related to the facts
Prepared database code you can save so the code can be reused, often with improved performance over ad hoc code
Data is gathered and processed very near to the time it is generated, from microseconds to a few minutes, such that the data is delivered in a near continuous fashion
Data wrangling and implementing data-driven artificial intelligence solutions both fall within the many possible specializations undertaken by this data professional.
A resizable component on a Power BI dashboard; each one displays a visulisation that ca be as complex as a bubble chart or as simple as a single value
A protocol that protects data in motion, for example, travelling between the cloud services and customers
A step in both of the 2 major approaches to data processing, where data is converted into a form most appropriate for analytical interaction
The act of gathering, cleansing, transforming, and storing data from multiple sources for use by other systems and processes or for further analysis and reporting.
A security feature that protects an entire database file (data at rest) so it cannot be read unless the host application is secured using the same key
This data professional will often be responsible for setting up database security and encryption configurations as well as managing and monitoring IaaS infrastructure.
A collection of data from one or more sources used to generate Visualizations that can be aggregated into reports.
After provisioning the storage account or underlying database infrastructure, a database administrator or a data engineer will ______ specific resources into that infrastructure.
One of 2 primary table types in star and snowflake data models, this table type often represents people, places, objects, and time.
In a data sense, this describes a data container that stores human-readable, semi-structured data in the form of JSON, XML, YAML, and others.
A database configuration that favors fast performance over ensuring data sources are in perfect sync at all times.
Step in both of the 2 major approaches to data processing, where ingested data is selectively pulled into the process for transformation and final storage.
A type of database made up of Nodes and Edges, which is particularly well suited to social networking applications and certain scientific applications.
A language used for querying/traversing across a graph data source.
Process of pulling data into a data platform environment from multiple sources, via either batch processing or stream processing.
A type of semi-structured data in human-readable form and stored on documents; similar in nature to XML and YAML.
Chart that surfaces the factors that affect a key metric.
Semi-structured format, where entities are organized into tables with rows uniquely identified by a key and a flexible number of columns; similar to Wide-Column data format.
Chart that allows for the measure of numeric data over 2 axes, with the X-axis often representing time.
Step in both of the 2 major approaches to data processing, whereby the data comes to rest in a particular data resource for consumption by other processes or humans.
A downloadable tool used to create interactive reports and Visualizations.
Service designed for viewing shared Power BI dashboards and reports.
Online platform focused on building, publishing, and sharing dashboards.
This resource combines internal and external data in multiple forms into a unified solution for analytics.
BSON document database that is supported on Azure through a Cosmos DB API.
A database that can support more than one data format.
In graph databases, entities and relationships are also referred to as these 2 terms.
A data storage resource that stores semi-structured data or non-structured data.
A place to collaborate in building Power BI assets in the Power BI service.
Also known as column-family, this type of database stores tables with rows, where a different set of columns can be defined for each row.
Visualisation that uses interlocking rectangles, with colour coding, size, and position to express relative value and some simple hierarchies
A language used for batch jobs over large amounts of data in Azure data Lake Analytics
A network in Azure that mimics the form of on-premises, hardware-based networks
A table in which data is stored in an unordered structure.
BLANK provides a centralized hub to assess and migrate on-premises servers, infrastructure, applications, and data to Azure.
BLANK joins two queries (tables) together based on a common field (column).
